dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 9525 IH: Continuing Appropriations and Health Extenders Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Roy introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: Making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2023, extending various health programs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Short title
section.text: This Act may be cited as the Continuing Appropriations and Health Extenders Act of 2022.

section.header: Extension of appropriations
section.text: Section 106(3) of division A of the Continuing Appropriations and Ukraine Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2023 (Public Law 117–180; 136 Stat. 2116) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: PAYGO report
section.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a) of section 5 of the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010 (2 U.S.C. 934), the Office of Management and Budget shall make publicly available the annual PAYGO report required under such subsection for 2022 and prepare any order required under subsection (b) of such section not later than February 4, 2023.

title.header: Extensions, Technical Corrections, and Other Matters

section.header: Extension of FCC Auction Authority
section.text: Section 309(j)(11) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 309(j)(11)) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: Extension of Authorization for Special Assessment for Domestic Trafficking Victims’ Fund
section.text: Section 3014(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended, in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: Extension of Commodity Futures Trading Commission Customer Protection Fund Expenses Account
section.text: Section 1(b) of Public Law 117–25 (135 Stat. 297) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 each place it appears and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: Extension of increased inpatient hospital payment adjustment for certain low-volume hospitals

subsection.text: Section 1886(d)(12) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(12)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023;

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subclause (I), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023;
in subclause (III), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023; and
in subclause (IV), by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023; and
in clause (ii), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of Health and Human Services may implement the provisions of, including the amendments made by, this section by program instruction or otherwise.

section.header: Extension of the Medicare-dependent hospital (MDH) program

subsection.text: Section 1886(d)(5)(G) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(d)(5)(G)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023; and
in clause (ii)(II), by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023.
Section 1886(b)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(b)(3)(D)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023; and
in clause (iv), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

paragraph.text: Section 13501(e)(2) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 (42 U.S.C. 1395ww note) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: Extension of increased FMAPs for the territories
section.text: Section 1905(ff) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d(ff)) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 each place it appears and inserting February 3, 2023 in each such place.

section.header: Extension of maternal, infant, and early childhood home visiting programs
section.text: Activities authorized by section 511 of the Social Security Act shall continue through February 3, 2023, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2022, and out of any money in the Treasury of the United States not otherwise appropriated, there is hereby appropriated for such purpose an amount equal to the pro rata portion of the amount appropriated for such activities for fiscal year 2022.

section.header: Extension of child and family services programs
section.text: Activities authorized by part B of title IV of the Social Security Act shall continue through February 3, 2023, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2022, and out of any money in the Treasury of the United States not otherwise appropriated, there are hereby appropriated such sums as may be necessary for such purpose.

section.header: Extension of moratorium relating to funds for health care services for certain Alaska Native villages
section.text: Section 424(a) of the Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2014 (Public Law 113–76; 128 Stat. 343; 132 Stat. 693; 136 Stat. 2136) is amended by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of the best pharmaceuticals for children program
section.text: Section 409I(d)(1) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 284m(d)(1)) is amended by striking $5,273,973 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022 and ending on December 16, 2022 and inserting $8,630,138 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on February 3, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of the humanitarian device exemption incentive
section.text: Section 520(m)(6)(A)(iv) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 360j(m)(6)(A)(iv)) is amended by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of the pediatric device consortia program
section.text: Section 305(e) of the Food and Drug Administration Amendments Act of 2007 (Public Law 110–85; 42 U.S.C. 282 note) is amended by striking $1,107,534 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on December 16, 2022 and inserting $1,812,328 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on February 3, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of provision pertaining to drugs containing single enantiomers
section.text: Section 505(u)(4) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355(u)(4)) is amended by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of the critical path public-private partnership
section.text: Section 566(f) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 360bbb–5(f)) is amended by striking $1,265,753 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022 and ending on December 16, 2022 and inserting $2,071,232 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on February 3, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of orphan drug grants
section.text: Section 5(c) of the Orphan Drug Act (21 U.S.C. 360ee(c)) is amended by striking $6,328,767 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on December 16, 2022 and inserting $10,356,164 for the period beginning on October 1, 2022, and ending on February 3, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of certain device inspections
section.text: Section 704(g)(11) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 374(g)(11)) is amended by striking December 17, 2022 and inserting February 4, 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of reporting requirements related to pending generic drug applications and priority review applications
section.text: Section 807 of the FDA Reauthorization Act of 2017 (Public Law 115–52) is amended, in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking December 16, 2022 and inserting February 3, 2023.
